pinyin: dà nàn bù sǐ bì yǒu hòu fú
meaning: If you survive a great disaster, you are bound to have good fortune later.
description: Surviving a near-death experience implies virtue/luck, and having one's life saved suggests that future fortunes are to be expected. Equivalent to 「What doesn't kill you makes you stronger」 or 「A cat has nine lives」.

examples.chinese: 大难不死,必有后福,祝早日康复
examples.translation: Surviving a disaster brings future fortune; wishing you a speedy recovery.

examples.chinese: 大出血出院后朋友都说大难不死必有后福
examples.translation: After being discharged from massive bleeding, friends all said that surviving a disaster brings good fortune.

examples.chinese: 大难不死,必有后福,今天风大的差点被广告牌打中
examples.translation: Surviving a disaster brings good fortune; today the wind was so strong I was almost hit by a billboard.
